suite_description: Comprehensive test covering React basics, hooks, performance optimization, and advanced patterns. Perfect for developers looking to validate their React knowledge from beginner to expert level.

questions.description: What is ReactJS?
questions.correct_answer: A library

questions.description: What does JSX stand for?
questions.correct_answer: JavaScript XML
solution_steps: It allows HTML-like syntax in JavaScript

questions.description: Which hook is used to manage state in functional components?
questions.correct_answer: useState
hints: Most commonly used for simple state
solution_steps: useState is the primary hook for state management
It returns a state variable and a setter function

questions.description: What is the Virtual DOM?
options: A copy of the real DOM kept in memory
questions.correct_answer: A copy of the real DOM kept in memory
hints: React uses it for efficient updates
solution_steps: Virtual DOM is a lightweight copy of the actual DOM
React compares virtual DOM with previous version
Only changed elements are updated in real DOM

questions.description: Which method is used to update state in class components?
questions.correct_answer: this.setState()
solution_steps: It merges the new state with the old state

questions.description: What is prop drilling?
options: Passing props through multiple component levels
questions.correct_answer: Passing props through multiple component levels
hints: Can be solved with Context API
solution_steps: Prop drilling means passing props through intermediate components
The intermediate components don't use the props

questions.description: Which hook is used for side effects?
questions.correct_answer: useEffect
solution_steps: Can be used for data fetching, subscriptions, etc.

questions.description: What does the key prop do in React lists?
options: Helps React identify which items changed
questions.correct_answer: Helps React identify which items changed
solution_steps: Key prop helps React track elements in lists

questions.description: What is the purpose of React.Fragment?
options: Group multiple elements without adding extra DOM nodes
questions.correct_answer: Group multiple elements without adding extra DOM nodes
solution_steps: Fragment allows grouping children without extra nodes

questions.description: What is the Context API used for?
options: Sharing data across components without prop drilling
questions.correct_answer: Sharing data across components without prop drilling
solution_steps: Avoids passing props through every level

questions.description: What does useMemo do?
questions.correct_answer: Memoizes expensive calculations

questions.description: What is the difference between controlled and uncontrolled components?
options: Controlled components have React managing their state
questions.correct_answer: Controlled components have React managing their state
solution_steps: Controlled components store form data in React state
Uncontrolled components store data in the DOM

questions.description: What does useCallback do?
questions.correct_answer: Memoizes callback functions
solution_steps: Useful when passing callbacks to optimized child components

questions.description: What is React.memo()?
questions.correct_answer: A higher-order component for memoization
solution_steps: React.memo() is a HOC for performance optimization
Similar to PureComponent for functional components

questions.description: What are React portals used for?
options: Render children into a DOM node outside parent hierarchy
questions.correct_answer: Render children into a DOM node outside parent hierarchy
solution_steps: Portals render children into different DOM node
Useful for modals, tooltips, and overlays

questions.description: What is the purpose of useRef?
options: Access DOM elements and persist values across renders
questions.correct_answer: Access DOM elements and persist values across renders

questions.description: What is lazy loading in React?
questions.correct_answer: Loading components only when needed

questions.description: What is the purpose of Error Boundaries?
options: Catch JavaScript errors in component tree
questions.correct_answer: Catch JavaScript errors in component tree
solution_steps: Error Boundaries catch errors in child components

questions.description: What is the difference between useEffect and useLayoutEffect?
options: useLayoutEffect runs synchronously after DOM mutations
questions.correct_answer: useLayoutEffect runs synchronously after DOM mutations
solution_steps: useLayoutEffect runs synchronously after DOM mutations
useLayoutEffect can cause performance issues if overused

questions.description: What is reconciliation in React?
options: The process of updating the DOM efficiently
questions.correct_answer: The process of updating the DOM efficiently
solution_steps: Compares Virtual DOM with previous version
Determines minimal set of changes needed
